WorkItem.ClosedComment: I'm assuming this was fixed. If a similar problem reoccurs please open a new issue.
WorkItem.Description:
I was attempting to optimize gear for my bear when an unhandled exception occurred. I know I have alot of gems selected, but it runs quick enough on my PC.
It was using the attached character file.
Optimizer settings:
Maximum thoroughness
Calculation to optimize: limited threat
Additional Requirements
%chance to be crit <= 0
Mitigation % from armor >= 74
 
 
See the end of this message for details on invoking 
just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.
 
************** Exception Text **************
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
at Rawr.CalculationsBear.GetCharacterCalculations(Character character, Item additionalItem)
at Rawr.Optimizer.OptimizeCharacterThreadStart(Character character, String calculationToOptimize, OptimizationRequirement[] requirements, Int32 thoroughness, Boolean injectCharacter)

Comments.Message: The exception occurs any time I optimize for limited threat.
